description: I guess this place is brand new! I really liked the snazzy interior. I wanted some grub late at night after going to Super Bowl 50 events, but I didn't find anything I wanted to pay for and munch on. It's a nice menu though...just not in mood for this food..and bill! I asked the bartender for a non-alcoholic beverage and she made me a fruity fizzy concoction that costed $7.99. The bartender was so attentive, funny, and charming. Yay! This new place is a pretty cool spot in FiDi.
author: Denise C.

description:
While perusing Instagram like I normally do, I came across a beautiful room scape that was tropical, urban, feminine, and welcoming all in one. To my surprise it was a restaurant, and to my delight it was in the city I lived in! Times like this remind me of how much of San Francisco I have yet to discover despite having lived here for decades and eating my way through the city.

I made 5:30 reservations for happy hour with a girlfriend of mine and ordered one of their fancy (and probably overpriced) but delicious drinks, The Palm Beach while I waited. It was tart but not sugary sweet, and the Basil Hayden balanced it out. It was also a good indication of how the rest of the night would taste.

We ordered the ...

Garden Party - Super refreshing gin cocktail with a subtle hint of rosemary. Yep, that's happening again.

Barbarita - Quite possibly my second favorite, if not favorite spicy drink ever. The celery threw me off, but everything worked well. Yep, this is happening again. And again. And again. 

Roasted Bone Marrow - You know how criminals get a last meal? This would be on there, because it combines 2 of my most favorite delicacies: uni and bone marrow. Normally, I like both of these things as plain as can be, so that I can enjoy the taste, but this worked out perfectly.

Foie Gras Toast - It's a small serving, 4 toast points to be exact. However, the foie gras is so indulgent anymore might be overload. I'm lying, I could've eaten way more but it was a good amount to enjoy. It was like butter!

Lobster Roll - The lobster roll ... was a lobster roll. We only ordered it, because it was easiest to share. However, it wasn't anything special. What saved it was the uni butter. 

Pineapple sundae - Simple, yet surprisingly delicious. The pistachios were a nice touch. 

Chocolate mousse - These are tiny, but don't order 2. We both figured since it was told to be the most popular item on the menu that we would want our own. Never mind that neither of us were big chocolate mousse fans lol. Just too rich for our taste, but not bad in general.

All in all, this is my review for my first experience there. I'm sure there will be many more, as it's the perfect little spot for a girls night out or girls HH. While men will absolutely enjoy it as well, the ambiance just screams girl time.
author: Abby B.

description: Yuuuum. If u luv oysters, come try this out! Steps away from my office on Sacramento cross Montgomery. Cute little joint. Came here on Tuesday with a vendor for lunch. Tried out 6 different types of fresh oysters. Slurp them all up in two minutes. Fries were good. Lobster bisque superb. Devil egg! I had the tea leaf salad adding tuna carpaccio.  I'm in luv. Loads of herbs.
author: Vee V.

description: Fantastic quaint little place - superb service. A grand success and fantastic addition to our neighborhood. The service is among the best in the neighborhood, which, with rare exception, is all ready superb. FiDi is a special place which is fiercely competitive and Leo's is quite at home. The decor is relaxing - visit and you will see what I mean.
author: Michael G.

description: leo's has the whole package... ambience... Excellent oysters! Excellent service. Patrick was our waiter great job!!
author: Jenn S.

description:
Absolutely one of my favorite spots in the city. I was sooo excited to try this place out, and it did not disappoint! 
Me and my wonderful guest shared: 
-fried oyster deviled egg 5/5 yummy!
-foie gras toast 5/5 GET. THIS. 
-steak tartare with uni 3.5/5 pretty standard steak tartare, heavy on the Dijon. wish it had more uni. 
-oysters & clams 5/5 clams were especially fantastic! we tried all the selections, the sweetwater oysters were standouts for me. we got a few with uni and caviar, as well... how could you go wrong. 
-garden party 5/5 delicious and beautiful 

the service was a little awkward? we at times couldn't understand/hear our server, but he kept us informed and was attentive enough. however, it was enough to keep this from being 5/5 overall. 

decor is amazing, congrats to them on their james beard nomination. 

will be back... and soon!
author: Erin S.

description: I looooooove this place. I didn't make a reservation (the only available slot was 9:30pm), so my friend and I did a walk-in for a spot at the bar. The tropical wallpaper/decor you see in pics is maybe 25% of the restaurant (both walls by the entrance, wall next to bathroom, and the bathrooms) and the rest of the restaurant is dark and has an intimate feel. The prices are steep, but the food did not disappoint. I didn't get any oysters because I don't like oysters enough to pay more than $1 each and to know the difference between good and bad ones. I got a deviled egg (for $6 you get one deviled egg... in other words half an egg), foie gras toast (4 small pieces for $20), and lobster roll ($32). The wing fried oyster and sauce on top of the deviled egg made it unique and delicious. The foie gras toast was aaaaaamazing and had strong flavors (so something to nibble on rather than take huge bites of). The lobster roll was delicious, but if I get it again next time, I would want to share it (can get it cut in half). I'll be back!
author: Annie S.

description:
Man, that was good - ate here the last two nights while in town for business. Sat at the raw bar. Oysters were top notch and clean.  Henry the GM, and the staff were really pleasant and knew the details about the dishes which was nice.  I'd have to say my fav dish was the ahi tuna carpaccio with tea leaf salad on top.

Superb!
author: Nick G.

description: Love this space! Cool vibe in a small, intimate space. Amazing raw bar with multiple kinds of oysters and shellfish. They have high quality wines and delicious craft drinks. The bartender, Zaudrey, is so nice as well. A great stop for happy hour or nice dinner. A real SF gem!
author: Derek C.

description:
I really thought about giving this a 3-star rating given the crazy prices and chilly attitudes of much of the staff, but the food, wine, and back bar were redeeming enough that I thought 4 stars was more appropriate.

For dinner, we sat at the bar, which I thought was nice.  They have a really funky backlit marble-like bar top, and you can watch the raw platters being prepared right there.  Generally, I really like the décor - it's like French Polynesian colonial without feeling overly theme-y or Disney-esque.

I was impressed with their wine selection - some really great California options, and I had a fantastic French Melon that paired perfectly with our raw bar choices.  

For dinner, the two of us ordered the assorted pickled vegetables, cinnamon spiced nuts, 5 Kusshi oysters, 4 Shigoku oysters, 3 Peter's Point oysters, 1 Oyster "Eloise," 1 Fancy Oyster, 4 Cherrystone Clams, and 3 Shrimp Cocktails.  The oyster quality was A+++.  I LOVED the Fancy Oyster, even if the horseradish temporarily blinded me!  I didn't have the Oyster Eloise, but I heard good things.  Their cocktail sauce is amazingly tasty, which is why I had to order a third Shrimp Cocktail.  The bar snacks were fantastic.  The only thing we didn't like were the Cherrystone Clams - they were just so "fishy."  I think that's always a risk with these, but my boyfriend was extra judgmental since he lived in MA for many years and would get them fresh out of the water...

We had initially planned to get more food from the main menu, but this ended up being quite filling.  After dinner, however, we went and had a drink in the hidden back bar - The Hideaway - where we ended up ordering their AMAZING gravy fries.  They are a must-try.  I look forward to going back in warmer weather once The Hideaway's outdoor patio is open.

Overall, this is a great addition to the area and worth the prices perhaps for special occasions.  I think they'd be well served to add some kind of oyster happy hour, however...
author: Tay H.

description:
Food was just Okay... 
Nothing to write home about. 
I mean the Oysters were great,  very tasty but everything else was just OK and way overpriced. 

Decorations were nice and tastefully done but the place was way too small.  So awkward sitting so close to strangers.
author: Lulu P.

description:
Beautiful place. We were charmed from the doors on in. Great space, great bar, great design, and it extends to the menus, the typography, great execution overall. Super nice dinner with oysters, beef tartare, trout roe, tuna carpaccio, black cod, and some very nice champagne. It was a special occasion and Leo's more than made the grade. If I had any complaint at all it's simply that dinner was expensive but that's what you get in downtown SF when you order up a big plate of oysters and bubbles, etc. I do think it's excessive for *anyone* to charge $3+ per oyster when I grew up eating them at Tomales Bay Oyster for $0.43 each, but that's not Leo's fault per se, it's SOP anywhere in the City. Shine your shoes and get your roll of clams ready, eat at Leo's! 

PS there are two back rooms and a back bar -- would be a great place for an event!
author: Bowen D.

description: I came here for my boyfriend's birthday dinner. I chose it because I love the ambiance and decor, it's a small restaurant so it also feels intimate. I came here for happy hour before and didn't order much, so I was excited to try more of the menu. We ordered some fresh oysters, foie gras toast, hamachi, bone marrow, steamed clams, lemon mousse, chocolate mousse and a bottle of wine. Everything was delicious and tasted very fresh. I was very impressed with the service as well, friendly waiters who passed by quietly letting you enjoy your time in the dimly lit space. I'll definitely be back here again sometime soon!
author: Stacy S.

description: Came here for my 30th birthday and it was great! We sat in the back room and the decor is gorgeous. The service was impeccable and the food - WOW. Get the deviled egg with buffalo oyster. The lobster roll was perfect and the octopus was another favorite. I wish I lived in SF so I could come back often!
author: Ashley G.

description: Thursday night and this place was jumping! Delicious flavors and excellent drinks. This place gets loud and the tables are small but the bar is very cool and spacious. Great service from everyone!!
author: Cecilia D.

description:
Jennifer Puccio does it again!  Where in the world do I begin??  The space, the ambiance and the staff were all fantastic.  The oysters on the half-shell were delicious, as were the cocktails (I had the Mad Man and Office Supplies).  The deviled egg?  Ridiculous.  The baked oyster carbonara, are you kidding me?  in.SANELY good.

The lobster cake, foie gras, lobster bisque and steelhead trout were all legendary as well.  Couldn't be happier with the experience and will definitely be back.
author: Matt V.

description:
I'm in love with Leo's! If you like fresh seafood this is your spot. 

They have a great raw bar with some of the most delicious oysters and shrimp. They are also very good at recommending a nice wine pairing. I had never tried some of the wines on the list and they have turned out to be some of the best I've had! 

It is a little more on the pricey side but totally worth it!
author: Sinem S.

description: Very pleasant experience all around.  Wait staff and bartenders incredibly friendly, attentive, and helpful.  Oysters fresh.  Were willing to work with my gluten free companion.  High energy, but wait staff kept it solid.  Go.
author: David Y.

description:
Magical experience. I will be back again and again. I'm not usually a cocktail drinker but these cocktails are phenomenal - have the garden cocktail. They're not too sweet, not too bland. Such a perfect frothy blend of everything you'd love.

The food was also great! Start with a deviled egg (it's a bit spicy but amazing) then try the ahi tuna carpaccio tea leaf salad. And for desert, have the chocolate mousse!

The service is amazing! Kassandra is the best - she came up with the drink menu. And the place is beautiful. Great date spot. A bit small but the lighting, decor, branding, and music were heavenly.

Nothing bad to say about this place! Great great place.
author: Ley M.

description: Leo's might be my new go-to spot! Ambience is like no other I've experienced in the FiDi, the service is top notch, and the various selection of oysters are to die for! If you want something other than oysters I'd recommend the deviled eggs, bone marrow and lamb tartare.
author: Constance Y.

description:
1 Shrimp salad, 1 lobster roll and 10 non-fancy oysters. Bill came out to $100 exact including tips, no drinks.

This is definitely on the high side for a business lunch given there were minimal plating skills nor wow-factors involved.

Would not recommend. Nevertheless, I do adore Marlowe.
author: Catalina C.

description: Most importantly, the food was off the hook. We shared a bunch of small plates/appetizers and were pretty impressed with everything. The caviar bites were awesome, the foie toast was insanely good, and I loved the hamachi (amongst everything else). We had a reservation that ended up being about 20-minutes late, which was no big (we sat at the bar and had a couple of drinks while we waited) and they went way above and beyond for us as an apology, which was totally unnecessary, but much appreciated. Can't wait to get back and pay full price for everything.
author: Quinn O.

description: I heard about this place through a friend, and saw that they had "lobster rolls" on the menu, so I went after a doctor's appointment, as I don't live close to here. I was expecting not to be able to be seated, since it was in the middle of the lunch busy time. But I got seated at the bar and started out with an oyster shooter topped with caviar. (Brilliant!). Even though the place was packed, my lobster roll came within 5-10 minutes. It was incredible, on a nice fresh baked artisan roll. The thing that was amazing, is that the lobster meat was served without the usual mayo dressing. They gave you the opportunity to add the red aioli that was on the side as much or as sparingly as you wanted (Nice Touch!). It was served with fries, which were fantastic. All this topped with a great Sauvignon Blanc, made my day. I can't wait to come back here again.
author: Timothy L.

description: Out-of-the-way location is cool. Main dining room with bar is nice. But we weren't seated there. We walked back to a back dining room. Windowless but bustling. That was okay. But we weren't seated there either. We were then lead into a small room off the back room. Small. Decore was bad tiki. Tiki can be cool, this tiki was an afterhought. The room was a converted outdoor area constructed for the sole purpose of cramming a few more covers into a night's effort. Service was great. Food was okay, but absolutely made less appetizer by the crappy environ. When you're paying that much money for dinner, you should get to enjoy it in nicer surroundings. Much nicer. Lesson learned.
author: Norm C.

description: My girlfriend's hair was burned by the candle on the table because the table is TOO SMALL to avoid the candle!!! Niether the manager nor server said sorry to her. The only words the manager said was 'are you ok? and we have to change the table cloth because we are professional.' How professional would that be!!! EXtremely crowded and loud place. Food was just ok but no worth it AT ALL. We need an apology instead of changing the table cloth. A place we will never go again.
author: Yuxiang G.

description: So so good! Very cute, but small inside so recommend making a reservation. The cocktails were great, clam chowder was like heaven! Probably the best I've ever had. The oysters were fresh and delicious. We also split a lobster roll--no complaints about anything. Lovely dinner!
author: Taylor G.

description:
Expensive! I mean really expensive.. Our bill was $180 and we didn't even have caviar! We started with some oysters and cherry stone clams. Presentation was beautiful $4-$5 per oyster. The shrimp was a rip off. It looked like pre- packaged peeled and deveined from farmed source. Not good. Clams were excellent. We also had the clam chowder...I recommend skipping this. We also had 1 baked oyster that was not remarkable. The smoked trout dip was presented like cat food and had was so firm the chips they served with it broke as you dipped. Lastly I was an idiot an ordered the $18 Bloody Mary that tasted like worcestershire sauce. Did I mention it was $18!? If you charge that much for a Bloody Mary it better be the business! My husband had an egg dish I think a deviled egg he ate it?
Another issue was the nonchalant staff members discussing their personal lives with the bartender at the prices you charge there Should be a floor show! I get it SF rent is expensive but $180 wow.
Positives 
Our server was very nice and attentive
The decor is nice
author: Angie S.

description: This is a gem. Interesting and bustling atmosphere with really friendly staff. Food was outstanding and we tasted a number of items on the menu. Good service, champagne and fresh and delicious food made for great evening out and one that will be repeated.
author: Jeanne H.

description: Amazingly fresh oysters and excellent service. We sat at the oyster bar and i would highly recommend you do the same!
author: Brad T.

description:
A real head-scratcher. On the one hand, I love oysters, tea leaf salad, and adorable-if-eclectic decor. I mean, the tropical wallpaper matches the servers' ties and the menus *hearteyes*

But, you see, here's what I want when I pay $68 for lunch for two: to not be hungry afterwards. To not wish I had eaten at Chipotle instead. Is this too much to ask? 

You see, the food was good but the portion sizes are oddly small. Come on Leo, a little extra lettuce on that $18 salad won't kill you.
author: Millie T.

description: Every time we come to SF we come here. Sit at the bar with Danny and/ or Cassandra. They're the best servers ever-- so attentive and will make sure you have the best time!
author: Natalie D.

description: I had lunch here yesterday and the food was delicious but watch out because it'll take a chunk of cash out of your wallet!   I got half an assortment of half a dozen raw oysters that ranged between $4 and $4.25: Chelsea Gem (WA), Shigoku (WA), Sweetwater (CA), Peter's Point (MA), Ring Point (ME) and St. Simon (NB).   The presentation was quite elegant and all the oysters were perfectly shucked.   I also got a couple of Hot Oysters:  Leo's Deviled Egg & Oyster Carbonara, each for $5.   Finally, I got the Salmon Tartare for $16.   While it was delicious, I didn't feel like I got my money's worth on that last dish in particular.  When I contrast it to the same dish at Bouchon in Yountville, I find that for the same price, you get a much more generous and delectable dish at Thomas Keller's establishment.  I accompanied my lunch with a nice crisp glass of Verdicchio from Italy which I thought paired beautifully with all my dishes.  All in all, a very nice and elegant lunch, but I can't give them 5 stars because I thought my lunch wasn't quite worth the value.   I walked out of Leo's close to $100 poorer and still somewhat hungry.   Would I come back?   Probably, but only if I was really craving oysters and I'd probably opt for a more substantial entree.
author: David O.

description:
Leo's GETS it. From excellent and unique cocktails to succulent oysters to incredible decor -- I was there for dinner about 12 hours ago and already can't wait to go back. The experience wasn't even marred by the fact that the party that had our table before us lingered so long we had to wait 30 minutes to be seated and at a different table. Staff was incredibly apologetic and comp'd us not only glasses of champagne but a delicious starter as well. Always appreciated.

The food: Our waitress told us her and the chef's favorite is the miso-broiled trout with golden trout roe, and honestly, I probably wouldn't have ordered it if she hadn't said to, but boy am I glad she did. It was cooked to perfection, buttery and luscious. 

A close second was the ahi tuna carpaccio, served with a tea leaf salad -- two things you wouldn't think go together but somehow are perfect complements. 

We got a secret menu item, called the "Marlowe" fries (an homage to the restaurant group who started Leo's, also owns Marlowe and Park Tavern) with braised short rib, cheese and other goodness heaped on top of a bowl of fries. Kind of like the fanciest best poutine I've ever had. 

The oysters were all incredible. Tried the Garden Party cocktail and loved it. Service was great, good music played all night and you can't beat the unique 1950s/tiki vibe (you'll get it if you go). One of the best dining experiences I've had in SF in awhile.
author: Elena K.

description: So I have to confess - I HATE oysters. So of course when my girlfriends suggested this place, I rolled my eyes and seriously started to consider whether I was friends with these ladies or not. I mean don't they know me at all? Oysters. Ick. But I went anyway because I really wanted to maintain the relationship. Well, well, well...to my surprise this place has some of the best french fries in the city!! I also ordered the green salad with rock shrimp for lunch. The light vinaigrette dressing was exactly what I needed so I didn't hit that after lunch "in need of a major nap" situation. The waiter was friendly, informative...there was even a bit of singing from the bar staff when the song "Hotel California" came on. It's small quaint, feels french and fancy. I topped off the lunch with a nice Floodgate 20 year Tawny Port. In all, it felt like a good little getaway in the middle of my day with my girls and I didn't have to endure not one oyster! I'll be back Leo, dahling. See you soon.
author: Rachel W.

description: We did the raw bar and it was delicious! King crab legs and St. Simones were my favorite - paired nicely with a (ok 3 glasses) chilled rosé. The playlist was spot on too ;) James Nicholas really knows that he's doing!
author: Brady R.

description: Delectable oysters, wonderful ambiance and impeccable service... And I found a friggin black pearl in the 1 clam I ordered
author: Donnie M.

description:
Overpriced, bad service but the wallpaper is alluring. 

Was enticed by the tropical feel of the welcoming wallpaper, but that feeling stops at the hostess booth. We sat at the bar, very excited about oysters and could not figure out why there were none on the menu. The woman sitting next to us was holding a long piece of paper and we asked her what it was, "oh, its the oyster menu." Hmmm....

Bar service was very unamused by our questions, forgot our "nuts", granted she comped them, but it did not make up for the condescending attitude.

Why pay $6 for ONE deviled egg when you can walk next store and eat many delicious eggS for $10.

Would I go there again: NO
author: Marla A.

description: Awesome spot to hit up after work for a happy hour. The staff were very gracious and the atmosphere is photoshoot worthy. They have a simple list of oysters to choose from and there cocktails are amazing! A little pricey but definitely worth the splurge.
author: Maggie S.

description: I dined at Leo's for the first time on a weekday for lunch.  Its facade and location on a dingy section of Sacramento, prompted me to say, 'these doors better open up to a fantasy Wonderland' (because of the high prices and sophisticated menu)... and they did.  The pink and green South Pacific decor is splendid.  My friend and I were extremely impressed with the oysters, which were phenomenal, as was the service from front to back of house.  My crab louie salad was a bit wet, good, but not great.  Still, I would return for the oysters and service.
author: Alex W.

description: My buddy and I showed up at 8:15 without a reservation. We were told that the wait was 45 minutes. On a Thursday! OK. I gave them my cell and headed to a wine bar around the corner. The oysters were definitely worth the wait as the list was diverse and the bivalves were fresh. The diver scallops with jalapeño on the crudos menu was equally tasty. The lobster roll unfortunately was a bit of a letdown as it really didn't have much lobster on it. Next time I'd stay away from the large plates and focus on the raw shellfish.
author: Vincent L.

description:
So I am middling one his place. A snazzy completely overpriced bar that charged twice the price for a Jameson should not strictly measure their drinks. 

We paid almost three times for smaller drinks. Didn't bother ordering.
author: Wayne B.

description: Great quality seafood! The oysters are amazing! Definitely order a sampling of the oysters!! The deviled egg oysters are a must have plus the carbonara. We tried all three and those were our favorite two. The mussels are cooked in parchment paper which really keeps the flavor. The lobster and crab bisque is another great item on the menu. Love the mayo dip for the French fries.. There's a roe flavor which makes it unique and so amazing!
author: Wendy K.

description: Delish oysters, ambience is cool. Love this place!
author: Lizzz K.

description: Most excellent evening. We were well taken care of by the very personable and knowledgeable front-of-house staff, kudos to all and thanks Carlos and Julia for keeping an extra special eye on us.  The food we enjoyed was well conceived, savory, and nicely presented. I had to pace myself not to appear too wolfish in gobbling down my seafood burger special, with a well paired white Bordeaux (I'll have another, please). My wife did equal justice to her lobster roll and champagne.  Chocolate mousse and a delicious confection, fresh strawberries, lemon mousse and brown butter streusel rounded the evening out. Well done all!
author: Michael H.

description:
The shrimp, bacon, avo toast here is absolutely amazing! It was really fun to order oysters and drinks because the waiters would ask questions about preferred flavors and suggest pairings. When they say an oyster has a fresh watermelon taste, it really does! 

The staff here is great; really friendly. Anyone who passed us would stop by the check in. I can't wait to come back next time I'm in SF!
author: Stephanie C.

description:
Great food and ambiance but pricey.

The inside reminded me of Liholiho, with the relaxed yet chic Hawaiian decor (but the similarities end there).

We started with multiple oysters, including red pearl - which I had never heard of. Heaven in a shell! They're gigantic!

We also had:
Uni toast - perfect!
Tater tots (I would say pass on this - it only comes with four tots...)
Deviled eggs - delicious, but $5 for one half of one egg
Clam chowder - large serving, flavorful, full of clam, potato.
Salmon entree - yum
Hamachi crudo - mouth watering
Crab and lobster cakes - one of the table favorites ($17 for one cake though)
Ice cream sundae - a must get! Vanilla ice cream with pineapple, pistachio, coconut - to die for

Skipped the shrimp cocktail, because like some of the other dishes - it only comes with ONE prawn. 

My cocktail was great, but the server took it while it was still half full. We were there at closing time, but still. 

Overall - I recommend but prepare to spend $$$$ if you want to leave satisfied.
author: Jessica C.

description:
Solid 4 star meal at Leo's Oyster Bar this weekend. As others have said, you walk in and it looks so small, but the restaurant actually has 3 distinct rooms to it (each decorated differently). We loved being seated in the 2nd room and it had an awesome vibe that added to the experience.

We basically loved everything we tried: the oysters on the half shell, the deviled egg with fried oyster, baked oyster carbonara, house-made tator tots, and lobster roll. The rock shrimp toast was probably the only thing we tried that I wouldn't order again.

We had originally ordered a crab louie salad, but it was forgotten. When our check came, we were actually relieved they had forgotten it because we were so full (and it wasn't listed on the bill). Plenty of food for 2 people. Total came to $130 including one tonic water (no alcohol) for 2 people.

Will be back!
author: K. D.

description: This place is the quintessential financial district lunch spot in San Francisco.  Absolutely first class raw bar and cocktail experience.  The decor and menus display a unique sense of style that make Leo's one of a kind.  San Francisco is one of the best food towns in America, but I make it a point to eat here every time I visit.
author: George N.

description: I love this place, amazing for a date night or 4-5 friends to celebrate before dinner. Interior is great and service is good for sf standards. I live in new york so a bit bias about service and oyster quality. Overall had a great time here
author: Emine A.

description: Phenomenal old-school place absolutely takes you back in time to an extremely grand era. Unbelievable cocktails fantastic service and expertly a prepared imaginative dishes make this one place you do not want to miss. Take advantage of the incredible selection of fresh oysters he will not be disappointed.
author: Jimmy B.

description:
Tips: try at all costs to get a table in front room; order and enjoy oysters.

Great interior design, though we were in a windowless backroom that wasn't so fun.  Servers were super nice people, and service was good when it was available.  However, service was MIA for about half of our time there.  Oysters were excellent.  The wines were not inexpensive, which would have been fine if they had been more remarkable.  The ahi tuna carpaccio we had was tasty, but the salad that came with it was so salty we were only able to eat half of it.  Fries were excellent, too.
author: Luke F.

description:
Great new place !Staff was very  friendly and helpful and they have a cute room in the back also plus a private room .It is a bit quieter in the back.
Excellent wines by the glass . A bit on the pricey side but really excellent selection.
We had Leo's deviled eggs , excellent .Crab and Lobster cake with cucumber salad and Kampachi . Both dishes were very tasty and also looked pretty.
As our main we shared the halibut , pricey at $ 34 . It was slightly overcooked and therefore not too flaky . But all in all a satisfying dinner. We didn't have time to try dessert but would next time.
author: Maria C.

description: OK.     The food is tasty but the portions are quite small for the money.     For example the ahi tuna plate was nearly all salad.    The shrimp bacon club sandwich could fit in one hand.        Come on guys that's just ridiculous.       The decor is fun, so I'd only come back for drinks.
author: chris b.

description:
The decor is definitely the highlight of Leo's, the wallpaper and design of it is one of the most beautiful I have seen. Such a shame the food doesn't live up the same standard. I was expecting so much more and felt quite let down especially since it's not a cheap place. 
Drinks were good, and oysters ok but everything else was below par. I would go again for a cocktail but leave the food.
author: Allie S.

description: So good! Try the oysters. Drinks are balanced and strong. TRY THE LOBSTER ROLLS!!! Would totally recommend.
author: Julius H.

description: I have been to Leo's twice and have had 2 very mediocre experiences. I have left with buyer's remorse both times, as this place is way overpriced for very average food. My first dinner was not great, and thought I'd give it another shot. But I was disappointed again and will definitely not be returning. Such a bummer since the menu does look so good! The bisque tasted like they forgot to put cream in it, very watery. The crudo is very so-so. The deviled egg with fried oyster is very good, but not good enough to come back just for that. I recommend taking your money elsewhere, as you can get a less expensive much tastier meal at other restaurants.
author: Andrea A.

description:
Tried getting a reservation for weeks, and finally did-- TOTALLY worth it.. the BEST oysters I've had anywhere in a long while..  but save room for dessert!!  The Lemon mousse with brown sugar crumble is worth coming in for .. alone!
I've already made my next reservation.. find an excuse.. and GO!
author: Kelly C.

description:
This place is so good! Went for our anniversary and it was great for a special occasion. We tried a bunch of different things on the menu and loved it all. Our personal favorites were the tater tots, short rib, and the oysters. 

Great cocktails. We sampled a few, great presentation. 

Check out the hideaway if you can. It's a lounge in the back with a small bar, great tropical vibes.
author: Ron N.

description:
A restaurant that definitely stands out in the financial district!  Leo's is a cocktail and oyster bar with flair.  To the left is a long bar with a vintage vibe.  There are plenty of seats.  Banquets on the right are narrow, but fun.  

We arrived at opening on a Friday afternoon so the full menu was not yet offered.  However, we tried everything from the raw bar and nothing disappointed!  We stayed long enough to try the uni toast, and it was worth it.  A definite must try.

Leo's is very reminiscent of Maison Premiere in Brooklyn!  Too bad Leo's doesn't offer outdoor seating in a cute, lush-filled patio.

If the prices weren't so high, I'd come here regularly.
author: K V.

description: Have you ever sat down to lunch and prayed to see "Liquid Lunch" on a menu, but, alas, no such option existed on the menu? More than once? Me too. Before anyone is too quick to judge, this liquid lunch includes a side of petite pickled veggies with a martini of your preference. So you wouldn't be lying by telling your coworkers you had a light lunch... {Read the rest on Rx Sojourn}
author: Roxy G.

description:
Henry the General Manager contacted me regarding the issues my wife and I experienced and we appreciate his genuine concerns.  

This place is clean and we look forward to giving them another shot when we are back in town.  It kind of sounds like our issue may have been an isolated issue.  

Thank you Henry.
author: B N.

description: Amazing food, if a bit on the pricey side. This might be my favorite restaurant in SF. The lobster roll is to die for, the clam chowder is amazing, and their raw bar offerings are great. Cute bar area as well. Gorgeous space, can easily see why this restaurant gets so many  postings on Insta.
author: Allie G.

description: The food was very good but holy heck it was so loud inside we couldn't hear each other across a tiny table. We had the clams and the seafood burger - both delicious. But with that level of noise I wouldn't go back.
author: Blake S.

description: Love the kitschy Hawaiian vibe. Seafood is good, with tons of raw bar options, but it is EXPENSIVE. Felt overpriced, but what's to be expected in a city where every establishment thinks the inhabitants are all rich.
author: Jeanna B.

description: Great place to enjoy some oyster but highly recommend the Japanese Hamachi with crusted avocado. One of the best!
author: Luis C.

description: Delicious!  We got to sit in the back room which was much less noisy and had a romantic feel to it.  Being gluten and dairy free I was worried about how much I would be able to eat off their already limited menu.  To my surprise I was able to get quite a few things and it was all delicious.
author: Kyla G.

description: Excellent food and cozy ambience... Fancy Oysters were the best. Worthy of Michelin star!!
author: Sanchit G.

description: Superb experience.  The space is gorgeous, the food is excellent, and the service is attentive.  Highlights include the seafood bisque, the foie gras toast, the short ribs, and the chocolate mousse.  Particular thanks to our fantastic, birthday-saving server and a gracious hostess who let us tour the space.
author: DarkwingDick _.

description: Good oysters, old-time ambiance. However, very expensive considering there are many wonderful places to eat oysters in San Francisco..
author: NatdeMontreal G.

description: I was beyond excited to come here. Mainly cause I LOVE seafood. We left disappointed. And bought food on the way home cause we were still hungry. I'm happy to say we tried it though. That is all.
author: mel l.

description: This place has a very charming old world yet slightly exotic Rick's Café Americain vibe to it. I loved the atmosphere, the service, and the drinks and food, but ultimately, the portion sizes make the prices absolutely absurd. I plan to return for special occasions (and hopefully on someone else's dime!) but am already preparing to leave feeling ripped off.
author: Jessica M.

description: Wonderful raw bar. Had 6 excellent oysters and  amazing hazelnut cookies for dessert. Wine pairings are very nice.
author: Dodie B.

description: Awesome lunch! The oysters (all 16 of them) were amazing!! The deviled egg with the fried oyster and buffalo wing sauce...insane.  Go see Zadri at the bar - great bartender. Cannot say enough about how much we loved this place!!!
author: Sean M.

description: Highly overrated. Ordered several different oysters. They were ok. Nothing special. Had the tuna carpaccio. The salad was better than the tuna. Next was hamachi with charred avocado. Over priced for the flavor and size. I ordered the house made tatter tots w salted cod and olive tapenade. They were decent but nothing to write home about. I had the clam chowder. It was extremely bland and no clams to be seen in it. Also got the fries. They were ok but their dipping sauce tasted like mayo and schiracha mixed together. Nothing special. All in all the food was over priced and just  so-so.
author: Heather H.

description: Been wanting to try for awhile now after hearing a co worker rave about this place. Hidden away behind big doors to a paradise. The hostess greets you with such an upbeat energy and you're off from your high stress day into your oasis. Service was excellent offering coat check and water. Perfect for an after wrk happy hour cocktail and oysters. Love it!
author: tricia m.

description: The food was tasty and the service was friendly, but I walked out the door hungry, sober, and with $200 less in my pocket. Very poor value.
author: Da Wei S.

description: I picked this place because I was craving East Coast clams and oysters. They have 'em here. I'm not really sure that the place deserves the accolades or the pricing though. Sparkling wine by the glass was priced way, way over the mark-up and while the shellfish is good; it's not better than anywhere else in the City. Maybe the housing crisis has put it's digs into the inflated prices here. It's new, it's NICE; but it's not worth it for a ditzy server that can't remember a simple wine order or the number of oysters we wanted. I won't return.
author: Sherie R.

description:
Leo's.

Beautiful setting. Great drinks. Spit in your drink never coming back again, service.

We went with 6 friends. Called ahead for reservations and were told it wasn't necessary. Showed up, and was given attitude because we didn't have reservations.

Hm.

We were there for about an hour or so, ordered a few rounds of drinks & oysters for everyone. Sipping on the last drink we received, the waitress kept asking if we needed another drink. No, we weren't ready. Can we finish our drink first? 

Before we could finish our drink (6 of us mind you, none were finished, and aren't pacing like your grandma sipping on a hot tea) the waitress says unfortunately if you're not going to order another drink, the hostess needs you to leave...

Did we just get kicked out?

Didn't know it was possible for 6 ppl to get kicked out of a bar, spending plenty of money ($350+ w/ tip), and doing nothing at all? Dang, we had friends flying in town too. What an embarrassment.

Maybe this was our *unique* experience, but with so many great destinations in SF, I would steer clear.
author: Sean M.

description:
Love this place!

Honestly a gem in the sea of mediocre bars in San Francisco. There's a luxe 'palm beach in the 60's' vibe that is so unique and fun. That being said its definitely not kitschy at all and is really subtle/tasteful. The bar staff are amazing and their cocktails are both creative and delicious. At night its a little dark inside (the light is really soft and the amber bar glows!) but fantastic and bright/whimsical during the day. 

Tip: If you're in the mood for a cocktail, be sure to try the Garden Party!
author: Hailey H.

description: My first thought was how small this place was, we had reservations and a place wasn't ready for us. Eventually we got to sit comfortably and order and we sat next to the owner. Kind of neat! We got to see the extension/addition. That's so friendly!
author: Carmelo W.

description: One word, Beautiful! It's a tiny gem of a restaurant in FiDi. You walk in and are overcome with lush beauty. We sat at the bar where the service was warm and welcoming. The food and cocktails were all excellent and as the name suggests, seafood driven. It's like the gritty, genuine Swan Oyster Depot married a beautifully polished Polynesian woman and this is there lovely child. Its teeny and can get crowded, don't be overwhelmed...just enjoy.
author: Chili W.

description: I've been dying to try this place since I moved up here 8 months ago. So for my birthday I finally made reservations. It did not disappoint. First, the decor is absolutely gorgeous, every detail. And the food was amazing! My husband and I split every dish and neither of us had a single complaint. We got CA fresh oysters (5 stars) the tuna carpaccio (5 stars), and the mussels andouille (4.5 stars). Even the French fries were on point. For cocktails I got the Garden Party, which was really refreshing, and the Island Time, which looked like it would be really girly (it had cute little pansies floating in it) but was smoky and delicious. My husband got two Mad Mans and they were also very good. Finally, for dessert we had the Pineapple sundae and I think I literally moaned when I took a bite. On top of that the service was top notch. One note: there are a lot of reviews that complain about the price, but first, you get what you pay for. The seafood was incredibly fresh and well worth it. Second, SF is the second the most expensive city in the US, so if you want to go to a swanky restaurant you'll have to expect it won't be cheap.
author: shayna b.

description: The food at Leo's was very good.  Unfortunately, the portions were also VERY small for the cost.  Everything we ordered and tasted was great.  Unfortunately, the prices for the amount of food you get is just insane.
author: Nick W.

description: Awesome food!   So fresh and delicious.  You simply MUST try to reveled egg appetizer.  The daisy salad with ahi added was amazing.  Only reason it's not 5 stars is becuase of how close together the tables are - no private conversations can be had here!  Other than that it is great.  Great food and great staff.
author: Kate L.

description: My friend and I love to try new restaurants. We usually order a bunch of dishes so that we can try more things on the menu. We ordered: Leo's Deviled Egg with Wing Fried Oyster - awesome! Osetra - Creme Fraiche and Truffled Beet Pancake, the caviar was delicious! House Made Tater Tot - these were heavy, but delicious! Salmon Tartar - this was one of my favorites! Clam Chowder - this was delicious and hearty! Ahi Tuna Carpaccio - this had the equivalent to a tea salad on top and it was fabulous. And for dessert we had a lemon mousse that was out of this world! I would definitely recommend this place!
author: La Tache T.

description:
the food speaks for itself!
baked oyster with carbonara sauce, uni toast, foie gras toast, salmon roe caviar and the dynamite sauce for the fries has tobiko! everything was great and very comfortable
author: Marie r.

description: Love this place. We came late on a Friday night for drinks and had a great time. We were able to sit at the bar and enjoy a few of their signature cocktails and pickled veggies. I would recommend this place to everyone.
author: Tyler T.

description:
This place was so good! Service, atmosphere, food, decor...My friend and I were a walk-in at 5:30 on a Wednesday and were able to sit right at the bar.

Food: Hamachi Crudo, Foie Gras Toast, Crab and Shrimp Cake, Clam Chowder.
All of it was really good. I would go back to the foie gras any day! The food is a bit pricey, but the quality and taste are worth it.

Our server Jordan was very informative and attentive. We will definitely be coming back here.
author: David S.

description: Absolutely love this place! Eric is a fantastic server, he had remembered me from my first time there and treated us so well. Mel was also amazing and so sweet to give us a tour of the new patio area. The food is so delicious!! Perfect bites that fill you up, amazing oyster selection and the ambiance couldn't be cuter!
author: Lauren R.

description:
Fresh seafood, delicious foods and cocktails. Can't go wrong. We got there past 5pm when the restaurant opened and the place was already filled up. Come early!

We had the oysters, top neck clams, deviled egg buffalo fried oyster, tuna and seaweed fried oyster, strawberry sunday with balsamic and pistachio, live scallop crude, hamachi and chard avocado crude and clam chowder (best chowder we've had). Everything was excellent and on note!
author: T. N.

description: This is my favorite new place this year. Unbelievable service: my dinner mate wittily asked for a "corpse reviver #3" after hearing someone else order a #2.... 3 minutes later the waiter came back and said, "so I did some research and it looks like the #3 is equal parts brandy and fernet... do you still want that?" Incredible food: the deviled egg was wickedly sour spicy and savory, with a subtle creaminess to it that complimented the spicy fried oyster perfectly. The drinks were superb. The night was the kind of night you imagine when you think about the 50s. After work, 530, long discussions about existential dilemmas and delights with delicious savory bites and palm fronds in the distance. .
author: Luz S.

description: Stopped in for a drink last night and was impressed! Hostesses were extremely nice and accommodating, bartender was engaging and fun to talk to, and raw bar guys were friendly too. Bartender ran after us down the block when we forgot our umbrella - stellar service all around. Cocktails hand stirred, delish!
author: Allison S.

description: Went to Leo's with a large group of colleagues after seeing the write up in instyle magazine. We were seated in the back room "the hideaway" and were blown away by the food, service and decor. Everything that came out of the kitchen was delicious. From the lobster claws and crab legs to the shrimp toast and lobster roll, everything was fantastic. I will definitely be back!
author: Sarah S.

description: Food was good, though I couldn't decide if it was good because of how bourgeoisie the scene was or if it was actually good. I'm not sure that I care never to eat it again. Severely overpriced for what we ordered.
author: Tia D.

description: Ate here on my birthday, on a warm September night. The bar is lovely and the restaurant was bustling. We had reservations and arrived early but were shunted to an empty backroom where we waited to be served expensive food in an unremarkable environment. I requested that we move and we got placed at a small cocktail table in the room between the main restaurant and the backroom. Had the prices or portions been reasonable, it would have been forgivable.  They were not. It was a very expensive disappointment!
author: Sarah W.

description: Sat at the bar for happy hour with two friends- had pickled veggie side and some beautiful oysters!!! Ordered a few craft cocktails and a bottle of wine! Bartender was great!!!
author: Meghan L.

description: Awesome experience.. Delicious food and amazing drinks.. Recommend this place to everyone.. Me and my dad had a great time.. 10 on 10
author: Joshi M.

description: Leo's was excellent. We had the best waitress there, I think her name was Hillary. She told us the best things on the menu and her recommendations were absolutely spot on, best meal I've had in a while. We especially liked the salmon tartare and smoked trout (which is on the caviar section but as she pointed out, it's sort of misplaced because the caviar is the side show to the actual trout on the dish) which we loved and of course some great oysters. Must try!!!
author: Laura V.

description: Beautiful fancy oyster bar in FiDi. Loved the Wing Fried Deviled Egg, Uni Toast, Tuna Carpaccio, Lobster Roll.  Exactly what SF needs #glamorous
author: J. SOMA S.

description: You know, I really wanted to like this place.  Being the old Wexler's location that was near and dear to my heart, I wanted to give this place a shot.  Came here around 3pm hungry and desperate for a late lunch with a buddy of mine, noticing that it was a new restaurant to us, we decided to try it and was given a menu by the lovely hostess.  We ordered the Ostera caviar appetizer with cocktails, and was told the kitchen was closed until 5pm.  No worries, having skipped lunch, I figure, hey we'll go to Wayfare tavern next door and come back when your kitchen reopens at 5pm to try that awesome sounding caviar appetizer on the menu that lured us in.  After my late lunch at Wayfare Tavern (fried chicken was ridiculously good), I went back to Leo's next door to be true to my word to the waitress that I would return at 5pm.  Again we were given the same food menu by a different but equally lovely and polite hostess, and again I ordered the same thing that caught my eye on the menu, the Ostera caviar.  Was told the kitchen doesn't open until 5:30pm.  Well we tried, given misinformation about the kitchen opening at 5pm...  Some suggestions, don't give a food menu when the the kitchen is closed.  Caviar... It's from a jar or can.  All someone has to do is open the jar/can and serve on a plate with the mini pancake and crème fraîche, with minimal preparation.  And although the kitchen was "closed", I'm sure someone back there was capable of opening a jar or can of caviar.  As much as I want to rate this place on their food, I sadly never had it.  We tried to give it the benefit of the doubt, came back when told, but no luck.  Came back twice, no food.  0 stars for the restaurant, 4 for the hostesses that were polite yet gave us menus twice when the kitchen was closed.  Average 2.
author: John D.

description:
1= My family and I reserved a table a month out (7 people) and they sat us at the worst seat in the house. Right next to the front door that kept swinging open. 

2= When we booked a month out they required that we put down our credit card to hold the table which is totally fine. However, they caveated that if we canceled within 24 hours that we would be charged $75 per person which could ONLY be used as a Gift Card toward the restaraunt at a later time. WTF? 

3=Aside from from the Raw Bar the food was not very good (oysters were excellent but the rest of the menu was unimpressive).  

I would go back with a smaller party for drinks and raw bar ONLY.
author: Ashley S.

description: One of the best new restaurants in San Francisco.  Intimate, fun and the food is delicious!  Chef Puccio has brought luxury dining back to San Francisco in a casual and fun environment.  My favorite drink is the Babarita and you can never go wrong with the caviar service.  I've been twice and look forward to making it my next dining destination.
author: claudia r.

description: Stellar addition to the Financial District.  Salt Cod Tater Tots are a must try.  The oyster selection is stellar.  I even had an East Coast Oyster that I've never had before. The cocktails are spot on as well.  Looking forward to trying more that this new gem has to offer.
author: Ben P.

description:
Obsessed. Hands down, my new favorite restaurant; everything from the decor to the food/drinks and service is perfect. 

I don't think you can go wrong ordering anything from the menu but my favorites were the Deviled Eggs with fried oysters on top (literally something conjured from my dreams), the Salmon Tartare toast, and, of course, the hot Lobster Roll. The Tater Tots and the raw oyster bar... I could go on and on!

For drinks -- I had a wonderfully crisp Sauvignon Blanc recommended by our bartender and the Barbarita is a Leo's dangerously good take on a classic Margarita with some spice. 

The staff is wonderful -- knowledgeable and friendly -- and the ambiance is always fun!
author: Jackie G.

description: Oysters were excellent, great vibe, and service was on point. Hostess was attentive, polite and bar tender was friendly.  Little pricey but worth it.
author: Alex M.

description: Go, if you like $14 four sip "craft cocktails" and $18 stingy pour chards.  Otherwise, save your $$$.
author: Bill M.

description: What can I say? Leo's is the jam! Excellent seafood at a reasonable price. The decor is superb and the music is on point. Perfect date spot or anniversary celebration.
author: A A.

description: All around, not a great experience. My friend and I are big oyster lovers and it didn't seem like our server knew much, or cared much, about oysters. The accompaniments were fine, but fell way short of the oyster experience at, say, Hog Island. Our Louie salad was okay, and our lobster roll was lacking so much in flavor.  I just felt like more care was put into building a good looking, classic restaurant and writing a great menu, than ACTUALLY delivering great food or good service. It was a subpar experience... And I don't think I'll be returning.
author: Lucy B.

description: Emilia, Cassandra and Matt are amazing it keeps us coming back every weekend. The food is great and so are the drinks and they make you feel welcome.
author: Kevin T.

description: Leo's Oyster Bar offers some wonderful seafood dishes, but the cramped space and poor value for money detract from the overall experience. The portions are incredibly small for the price point of each dish. For example, while the lobster bisque is absolutely delicious, a $19 bowl is the equivalent size of a cup of soup elsewhere (albeit served in a bowl). Four tiny bowls for our table, was $76, which is a bit problematic when you consider that you'll need to order a lot more food in order to have a full meal. The sea urchin toast for $18 seems like it would be a fair portion, until you see a plate that consists of 3 very skinny strips of toast with some sea urchin put on top. For those of us who have been in San Francisco for several years, expensive prices are not abnormal. However, objectively speaking, if this restaurant wants to maintain this particular price point, they either need to increase the portion sizes or up the quality and presentation to the next level.
author: Justin G.

description: Leo's was excellent!! The food was amazing we tried many items and shared everything. The wine list was very impressive. The service was phenomenal! We cannot wait to go back!
author: L B.

description: I wanted to give this place 5 stars because all the small plates we had were insanely good - I'll dream about the salmon roe bites and the foie gras toast - but the mussels that came to the table steamed had only 30-40% of them open so we sent them back. And my husband, who doesn't like fish, ordered a "large plate" of beef ribs which was the only thing he could eat on the menu and it was TEENY. What made matters worse was that there was a large bone under the ribs making it even smaller ...and fat on the ribs making it an even SMALLER portion. While most dishes were excellent, they were all very small and the prices were very steep. The restaurant may want to work on adjusting those two things.
author: San Fran G.

description: We had reservations for a late dinner Saturday night at 10:00. We arrived early and our table wasn't ready yet but the staff went out of the way to make sure we were happy. Offered us a place to sit, water, drinks offered. Constantly checking in us. Table wasn't ready until later so they brought us a couple of small plate offerings. Food was great. Service amazing. A bit pricy but not overly so. Will definitely be back!
author: Alan T.

description: Great new restaurant/bar.  One of my new favorites!  If you love seafood / shell fish / raw bar and mighty mixology, this is the place for you.  Beautiful venue and warm ambience as well.  Go here immediately for a hip lunch, a swanky happy hour, or to impress your date for dinner.  I will be back often.
author: Isaac F.

description: Amazing experience! My husband and I were celebrating our 10th anniversary and from the minute we walked in, Leo's staff was accommodating, professional and energetic! Cocktails were seductively delicious, oysters were fresh and briney and lemon mousse was so tart and perfect. Highly recommend this new spot!
author: NIcole R.

description: This is a beautiful new restaurant with great food. The presentation of food looks like a work of art. We had the oysters on top of deviled egg to start- make sure you get two per person as they are delicious and hard to share. We then had the caviar on little crispy beets- it was amazing. also you need to get enough as they are tiny- but great. We the had the Tater Tots mélange. This was probably the best tater tot -type dish we have ever had!! It was so good- we definitely would and probably should have ordered more! This was followed by a lovely (large) portion of super fresh and meaty lobster roll which they nicely split for us (for two people- without our having to ask!) and even gave us each our own delicious fries. The white chardonnay the waiter recommended was perfect for this of  meal. service was impeccable, very professional. We ate at bar- highly recommend. Also, the bar tenders were making lots of interesting drinks that people at bar seemed to really enjoy. We will definitely go back- there were lots of other goodies on the menu that we would like to ry. Even though portions for some dishes were small, we were full and too full for dessert- though they looked amazing. And, also, ladies bathroom was spotless and overall noise level very comfortable- you can hear your dining companions without shouting.  In sum, this was a terrific Friday night dinner out.
author: Robyn G.
